bboxes.raw_text:
PHILADELPHIA = The month
long trial Of Bishop D. Ward
Nichols, suspended head of the
AME Church, ended with YER
dict of guilty.


He was found guilty on all IL
indictments which charged en-
bezzlement of $3.50, 900 of church
funds.


The "a yr. old man was COM
posed as the jury presented its
verdict. He could be imprisoned
S years on each count and fined
$1,000 for each.


Bishop Nichols was suspended
in 1860 as presiding bishop Of the
First Episcopal District of the
African Methodist Church. He
was charged with So counts of
misusing church funds.

WASHINGTON Howard Uni
versity officials announced the
beginning of the Bling Crosby
Youth Fund which will provide
$4,000 worth of scholarships.


Loans will be available to un-
dergraduate students and Howard
University was selected as one
of the participating universities
by the non profit corporation
which has its headquarters at
Monterey, California.

INDIANAPOLIS. Ind. Dele
gates to the annual NAACP Mid
western regional conference, ap-
proved massive protest demon
stration against the General
Motors Corporation Monday, May
4th.


Representatives from seven
states cheered resolution call
ing for the one-day demonstra-
ton in front of the automotive
headquarters in Detroit, Mich,
and for similar protest express
sions outside the corporations
showrooms and local offices in
so cities around the nation.


Herbert Hill, NAACP labor
secretary, who will lead the dem
onstration in Detroit, siad the
massive protest has been dubbed
"March On C.M.," and will be
the Negroes way of registering a
complaint against G MS "arro-
giant REFUSAL to alter its nation
wide pattern of discriminatory
practices.

Maricopa County Superior
Court Judge Henry S. Stevens
announced his candidacy for the
new Court of Appeals, subject
to the Republican primary re-
suits.


A native of Wisconsin he re-
ceived his bachelors degree
from the University of Wiscon-
sin and his law degree from the
University of Arizona.


With the exception of 8 III
years in the Air Force in World
War II. Judge Stevens has been
active in the legal profession
in Phoenix since he was admitted
to the State bar in 1881.

1.-THE NAACPis concerned with
the entire range of employment
opportunities in the G M. indus
trial empire. Beginning with the
supervisory level and up. G M.
is for the most part a lilly
white" operation. Our major en-
phasis is upon supervisory pro-
fessional, technical and other
white collar occupations This In
cludes employment as statesmen
and secretaries.


In the statement issued by the
representatives of NAACP units
in Michigan, Illinois, Ohio, In
diana, West Virginia, Wisconsin
and Kentucky, members of the
civil rights organization through
out the nation we're called upon
to continue conducting periodic
demonstrations against I'm.
offices, plants and dealers show
rooms until the Corporation dis
continue It's discriminatory prac-
tees.

Miss Becky Shaw, II, daugh-
ter of Mr.. and Mrs. A. H. Shaw,
l447 E. Coronado, is the first
Y-Teen delegate chosen to at
tend the YWCA national con-
vention.


She is spending a week in
Cleveland at the organization s
werd annual convention.


Others attending the conven-
ton are Mesdames Eugene Tom
pane, president B. K. English,
Y Wives representative Florance
Cross, Teens program director
and Agnes Kelly. program di-
rector.


Becky is a senior at North
High.


Last year she attended a Y
Teen convention in Hawaii.

North High Senior
Is Teen DeIegu ate

William Corbin, audiovisual
director at South Mountain High
School, Is attending the Depart
ment of Audiovisual Instruction,
of the National Education Asso-
citation at Rochester, MY.


He is a delegate from Phoenix
Union High School District.


A teacher in the high school
system for the past 10 years,
Mr.. Corbin also serves as au-
diovisual coordinator of the dis
trict high schools.

Burt Lancaster with members of the United
Chdren Choir with whom he will appear the NACP
Spectacular. The nationwide cosedcirct TV show
scheduled to be May IA.


first half of the two-hour Show
which originates the Los Angeles Sports Arena and New Yor
Madison Square Garden.


Tucson High School Stadium. For
tickets Rev. Casper Glenn 3O5 W. 23rd Sr Tucson

Little Theater, Tues April %.

couple Michigan ended enjoyable four months visit
in the with their family.


friends feted Rev. and Mrs. Emory M Barnes
Kalamazoo Michigan Saturday night in the social room at First
Institutional Baptist Church, 1l41 E. Jefferson.


Barnes has led active and interesting life teacher
social and religious education leader in
Michigan


married June 49, 1913 in Oklahoma.
June in Michigan
Standing Mike and Barnes Katherine and Eugene
LeCompte, grandchildren.


Mrs. Barnes Rev. and Mrs. E. M
Barnes Tany Barnes grandmother Mrs. Margaret
daughter and Mrs. Beatrice Grevenberg.


have five children and eight grandchildren
